Using GR8BRIK may seem like an impossible task, but it is really easy. First, I recommend registering an account, as there you can manage models, have a custom username, and secure your account and messages. If you don't register, GR8BRIK will not let you upload models, or post topics on the Community. You can still comment, but you will be "Anonymous User" and will have a set profile pic (that looks like this: http://www.gr8brik.rf.gd/acc/users/pfps/Anonymous%20User..jpg).
After registering, I recommend watching this video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4HCCpFntxdk (cool online Lego builder) to get ahold of the Modeler. To start, choose a brick. This can be done by clicking the block icon. There will be 6 bricks that you can select: 1x1 ,2x1, 2x2, 3x1, 3x2, 4x1 and 4x2. Once you have chosen; you can start building. You can change your color by clicking "PAINT" or the paintbrush icon. You can delete by holding "D" and rotate by holding "R".
Once you're done, save your model by clicking "Save to device". If you built everything wrong (somehow) you can click "Delete all". You can import an existing model by clicking "Load from device".
After you're done, you can upload your model (if you're logged in) by clicking on your username in the right-hand corner. And then finding "Upload model". Select the .Json model you saved and click "UPLOAD". The upload should start, and you will see it on the Creations page (and maybe your feed). Good luck using GR8BRIK!
